14#ifndef ISC_DIR_H
15#define ISC_DIR_H 1
16
17/*! \file */
18
19#include <sys/types.h> /* Required on some systems. */
20#include <dirent.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/result.h>
24
25#ifndef NAME_MAX
26#define NAME_MAX 256
27#endif
28
29#ifndef PATH_MAX
30#define PATH_MAX 1024
31#endif
32
33/*% Directory Entry */
34typedef struct isc_direntry {
35 char name[NAME_MAX];
36 unsigned int length;
37} isc_direntry_t;
38
39/*% Directory */
40typedef struct isc_dir {
41 unsigned int magic;
42 char dirname[PATH_MAX];
43 isc_direntry_t entry;
44 DIR * handle;
45} isc_dir_t;
46
47ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
48
49void
50isc_dir_init(isc_dir_t *dir);
51
52isc_result_t
53isc_dir_open(isc_dir_t *dir, const char *dirname);
54
55isc_result_t
56isc_dir_read(isc_dir_t *dir);
57
58isc_result_t
59isc_dir_reset(isc_dir_t *dir);
60
61void
62isc_dir_close(isc_dir_t *dir);
63
64isc_result_t
65isc_dir_chdir(const char *dirname);
66
67isc_result_t
68isc_dir_chroot(const char *dirname);
69
70isc_result_t
71isc_dir_createunique(char *templet);
72/*!<
73 * Use a templet (such as from isc_file_mktemplate()) to create a uniquely
74 * named, empty directory. The templet string is modified in place.
75 * If result == ISC_R_SUCCESS, it is the name of the directory that was
76 * created.
77 */
78
79ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
80
81#endif /* ISC_DIR_H */
82
